guide.introduction: This will teach you how to make a green-screen effect with iMovie, a free software package bundled with Macs.
guide.introduction_rendered:
This will teach you how to make a green-screen effect with iMovie, a free software package bundled with Macs.

Tools
  • Camera
  • Computer w/ iMovie
  • Green or Blue Surface

lines.text: Open Preferences and select Show Advanced Tools
lines.text_raw: Open Preferences and select Show Advanced Tools

lines.text: This will allow you to use the green/blue screen effect.
lines.text_raw: This will allow you to use the green/blue screen effect.

lines.text: Now, take some footage in front of the green (or blue) screen. Try to keep the screen and subject evenly lighted.
lines.text_raw: Now, take some footage in front of the green (or blue) screen. Try to keep the screen and subject evenly lighted.

lines.text: Also, choose the photo or video for the background.
lines.text_raw: Also, choose the photo or video for the background.

lines.text: Then, drag the green-screen video on top.
lines.text_raw: Then, drag the green-screen video on top.

lines.text: Select either green or blue screen, depending on what you used.
lines.text_raw: Select either green or blue screen, depending on what you used.

lines.text: You can drag the green-screen footage depending on where you want it to start.
lines.text_raw: You can drag the green-screen footage depending on where you want it to start.

lines.text: You are now done with the Green Screen w/ iMovie tutorial. Happy moviemaking!
lines.text_raw: You are now done with the Green Screen w/ iMovie tutorial. Happy moviemaking!

guide.summary: Do you want to walk on Mars or climb a volcano? You can make it look like you are anywhere with a green or blue screen.
